item.title: U.S. to Allow South Korean, Taiwan Chip Makers to Keep Operations in China
item.description: The U.S. government has reversed its previous policy and will now allow South Korean and Taiwanese chipmakers to keep their operations in China. This is a major shift in policy, as the U.S. had previously discouraged chipmakers from investing in China due to concerns about China’s growing technological capabilities.
